contentList.content: Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Acid damage. In addition, whenever you deal Acid damage, you deal [1] more.
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold damage. In addition, whenever you deal Cold damage, you deal [1] more.
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire damage. In addition, whenever you deal Fire damage, you deal [1] more.
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Lightning damage. In addition, whenever you deal Lightning damage, you deal [1] more.
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Thunder damage. In addition, whenever you deal Thunder damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Force
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Force damage. In addition, whenever you deal Force damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Necrotic
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic damage. In addition, whenever you deal Necrotic damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Poison
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Poison damage. In addition, whenever you deal Poison damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Psychic
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Psychic damage. In addition, whenever you deal Psychic damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Radiant
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Radiant damage. In addition, whenever you deal Radiant damage, you deal [1] more.
Elemental Adept: Poison
Your spells and attacks ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Poison damage. In addition, whenever you deal Poison damage, you deal [1] more.
Eldritch Adept

You learn one Eldritch Invocation from the Warlock class, and your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Fighting Initiate

You may choose to learn one fighting style from the Fighter class.

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Metamagic Adept

Gain two metamagic options and three Sorcery Points.

Your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have gained two metamagic options and three <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag>.
Crusher

Your Strength or Constitution increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can push it away from you, provided the target is Large or smaller. Also, when you score a critical hit with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.
Crusher: Move
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you move it [1] away from you, provided the target is Large or smaller.
Crusher: Crit
When you score a critical hit with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, attack rolls against that creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.
Crushed
Attack rolls against this creature are made with advantage until the start of your next turn.
Piercer

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

Once per turn, when dealing piercing damage with weapon attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result. Also, when you score a critical hit with an attack that deals piercing damage to a creature, the target receives Gaping Wounds.
Piercer: Reroll
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals piercing damage, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.
Piercer: Crit
When you score a critical hit with an attack that deals piercing damage to a creature, the target receives <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GAPING_WOUND">Gaping Wounds</LSTag>.
Slasher: Reduce Speed
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the speed of the target by [1] until the start of your next turn.
Slasher: Crit
When you score a critical hit with an attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Slasher: Reduced Speed
Movement reduced by [1]
Slasher: Disadvantage
Disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Slasher

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the speed of the target until the start of your next turn. Also, when you score a critical hit with an attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Slasher: Reduce Speed
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the speed of the target by [1] until the start of your next turn.
Slasher: Crit
When you score a critical hit with an attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.
Double Fist Puncher
When making an unarmed strike when you have nothing in your main hand or off hand, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> take a -5 penalty, but their damage increases by 10.
Heavy Weapon Master

When you land a Critical Hit or kill a target with a two-handed weapon you're Proficient with, you can make another attack with it as a bonus action that turn.

When attacking with a two-handed weapon you're Proficient with, add your Proficiency Bonus to the damage.

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Heavy Weapon Master: Always In

When attacking with a two-handed weapon you're <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with, add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to the damage. This bonus is inactive while All-In bonuses are enabled for Great Weapon Master / Sharpshoter.
Heavy Weapon Master: Bonus Attack

When you land a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> or kill a target with a two-handed weapon you're <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with, you can make another attack with it as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> that turn.
Can make an attack with your two-handed weapon as a bonus action.
Weapon must be <LSTag Tooltip="Heavy">Heavy</LSTag>.
Weapon can't be <LSTag Tooltip="Heavy">Heavy</LSTag>.
Savage Pugilist
When making unarmed attacks, you roll your damage dice twice and use the highest result.

Your Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

When you make crossbow attacks within melee range, the Attack Rolls do not have Disadvantage.

Your Piercing Shot also inflicts Gaping Wounds for twice as long.

You gain <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Charger_Attack">Charger: Weapon Attack</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_Charger_Push">Charger: Shove</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

Your Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

When attacked while wielding a Finesse Weapon you're Proficient with, you can use a reaction to add your Proficiency Bonus to your Armour Class, possibly causing the attack to miss.

Your Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

You gain Advantage on Perception Checks and on Dexterity Saving Throws while not in combat.

Your spells ignore Resistance to a damage type of your choice. When you cast spells of that type, you deal 1 additional damage.

Your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn two manoeuvres from the Battle Master subclass and gain two <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SuperiorityDie">Superiority Dice</LSTag> to fuel them. You regain expended Superiority Dice after a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
You receive 2 (additional) <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SuperiorityDie">Superiority Dice</LSTag>.

When you wear Medium Armour, it doesn't impose Disadvantage on Stealth Checks. The bonus to Armour Class you can gain from your Dexterity Modifier also becomes uncapped.

Your Strength or Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

When you wear Medium Armour, it doesn't impose <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>. The bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> you can gain from your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> also becomes uncapped.

Your Dexterity increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.

Your movement speed increases, and difficult terrain doesn't slow you down when you Dash.

If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke Opportunity Attacks from your target.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="MusicalInstrumentProficiency">Musical Instrument Proficiency</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in Performance, and your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You know how to play musical instruments and are Proficient in Performance.

You learn two ritual spells of your choice.

Your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn a cantrip, and the number you need to roll a Critical Hit with spells is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

Your Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the bard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the bard spell list.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the cleric spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Wisdom increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the cleric spell list.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the druid spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Wisdom increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the druid spell list.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the sorcerer spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the sorcerer spell list.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the warlock spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Charisma increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the warlock spell list.

You learn 2 cantrips and a Level 1 spell from the wizard spell list. You can cast the Level 1 spell once per Short Rest.

Your Intelligence increases by 1, to a maximmum of 20.
You have learnt 2 <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrips</LSTag> and a Level 1 spell from the wizard spell list.
You can cast the Level 1 spell once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.

When you make an unarmed attack, use an improvised weapon, or throw something, additionally add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to the damage and <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>.
Skill Expert

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in 1 <LSTag Tooltip="Skill">Skill</LSTag> of your choice, and <LSTag Tooltip="Expertise">Expertise</LSTag> in 1 <LSTag Tooltip="Skill">Skill</LSTag> of your choice.
